logic

Class Gamelogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Gamelogic

  • public class Gamelogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains many static methods to play a game of chess. Using the GUIController-interface, you can build your own custom chess-application with the help of those methods. Make sure to initialize the Gamelogic first, before using any other methods.
    Author:
    Moritz Rehschuh

      An ArrayList of TraceElements that stores every undone move in order.
      private static int RemisCounter
      A Counter that represents how many moves where made since the last pawn-move/kill.
      protected static Piece[][] snapshot
      An array to store a snapshot of the original chessboard.

      • Gamelogic

        public Gamelogic()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(GUIController caller,
                              Player[] playerList)
        This method initializes all data to prepare for a chess-game.
        Parameters:
        caller - The GUIController the Gamelogic shall respond to. Honestly just put "this" in here.
        playerList - An array of two Player-Objects, containing a Player with ChessColor.WHITE and one with ChessColor.BLACK

      • move

        public static boolean move(Piece piece,
                           Pos target)
        This method is used to make a move during a game. This will check if the move is possible, then execute the move and trigger every update-method of the data-set, including the checkKings()-method.
        Parameters:
        piece - The Piece-Object you want to move. The Piece needs to be taken from the chessboard.
        target - A Pos-Object containing the target-position.
        Returns:
        If the requested move is legal and has been executed correctly, returns true, else false.

      • clearAll

        public static void clearAll()
        Triggering this method will delete all data of the current chess-game. After using this method, the Gamelogic needs to be initiated again, before using any other methods of this class.

      • undo

        public static void undo()
        This method will undo the last turn of the game by loading the data of the latest TraceElement of the gameTrace and moving it to the redoTrace. If there are no further moves to undo, this method will do nothing.

      • redo

        public static void redo()
        This method will redo the last undone turn of the game by loading the data of the latest TraceElement of the redoTrace and moving it back to the gameTrace. If there are no further moves to redo, this method will do nothing.

      • checkKings

        public static void checkKings()
        This method checks for all game-ending criteria and notifies the corresponding methods of your GUIController if necessary. While you can trigger this method manually, it is not required, since it will be called after each turn by the move()-method.

      • countOccurrencesOfSituation

        private static int countOccurrencesOfSituation()
        A private method to determine if a situation on the board has already occurred during the game.
        Returns:
        An integer, representing how many times the current situation of the game has already occurred.

      • sendPromotionChoice

        public static boolean sendPromotionChoice(java.lang.String response)
        A method to respond if GUIController.choosePromotion() gets called. If the response can't be processed, it will return false.
        Parameters:
        response - A String that should be either: "Queen", "Rook", "Bishop" or "Knight"
        Returns:
        A boolean to determine if the response was accepted.

      • makeSnapshot

        protected static void makeSnapshot()
        An internal method to load the current state of the chessboard into the snapshot-array.

      • loadSnapshot

        protected static void loadSnapshot()
        An internal method to load the saved state of the game from the snapshot-array back to the chessboard.

      • project

        protected static void project(Pos oldPos,
                              Pos newPos)
        An internal method to move pieces from one position to another without actually triggering the triggerEvent()-method of that piece. This method is used to simulate future states of the board.
        Parameters:
        oldPos - The position where the piece is located now.
        newPos - The target-position of the piece.

      • getCurrentPlayerIndex

        protected static int getCurrentPlayerIndex()
        An internal Getter-method, returning the currentPlayerIndex.
        Returns:
        currentPlayerIndex

      • getRemisCounter

        protected static int getRemisCounter()
        An internal Getter-method, returning the RemisCounter.
        Returns:
        RemisCounter

      • getChessboard

        public static Piece[][] getChessboard()
        This Getter-method returns a copy of the chessboard-array.
        Returns:
        chessboard

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public static Player getCurrentPlayer()
        A Getter-method, returning the Player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The Player whose turn it is.
        See Also:
        getOtherPlayer()

      • getOtherPlayer

        public static Player getOtherPlayer()
        A Getter-method, returning the other Player.
        Returns:
        The inactive Player.
        See Also:
        getCurrentPlayer()

      • canClaimRemis

        public static boolean canClaimRemis()
        This method checks whether or not a remis can be claimed by the current player.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if a remis can be claimed.
